publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1612 Margaret Jamieson: Ocean Youth Trust Scotland—That the Parliament congratulates the Ocean Youth Trust Scotland on its work with young people on the 70 ft sailing vessel ALBA VENTURER, which has taken over 500 young people to sea on adventurous voyages on 197 days over the past year; notes that Ocean Youth Trust Scotland has, over the past 26 years, taken some 14,000 young people from different backgrounds over 125,000 miles, as far afield as St Kilda and Taransay, and welcomes the continued partnership between the Trust and the Scottish Executive Education Department to ensure that this valuable resource remains available to young people from across Scotland.
S1M-1612 Ocean Youth Trust Scotland (lodged on 31 January 2001) Alex Neil*

S1M-1612 Margaret Jamieson: Ocean Youth Trust Scotland—That the Parliament congratulates the Ocean Youth Trust Scotland on its work with young people on the 70 ft sailing vessel ALBA VENTURER, which has taken over 500 young people to sea on adventurous voyages on 197 days over the past year; notes that Ocean Youth Trust Scotland has, over the past 26 years, taken some 14,000 young people from different backgrounds over 125,000 miles, as far afield as St Kilda and Taransay, and welcomes the continued partnership between the Trust and the Scottish Executive Education Department to ensure that this valuable resource remains available to young people from across Scotland. Supported by: Alex Neil
S1M-1612 Ocean Youth Trust Scotland (lodged on 31 January 2001) Donald Gorrie*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Robin Harper*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Pauline McNeill*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-1612 Ocean Youth Trust Scotland (lodged on 31 January 2001) Tricia Marwick*, Karen Whitefield*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Michael Russell*, Irene Oldfather*
S1M-1612 Ocean Youth Trust Scotland (lodged on 31 January 2001) Ms Sandra White*, Nora Radcliffe*, Mr David Davidson*

S1M-1612 Margaret Jamieson: Ocean Youth Trust Scotland—That the Parliament congratulates the Ocean Youth Trust Scotland on its work with young people on the 70 ft sailing vessel ALBA VENTURER, which has taken over 500 young people to sea on adventurous voyages on 197 days over the past year; notes that Ocean Youth Trust Scotland has, over the past 26 years, taken some 14,000 young people from different backgrounds over 125,000 miles, as far afield as St Kilda and Taransay, and welcomes the continued partnership between the Trust and the Scottish Executive Education Department to ensure that this valuable resource remains available to young people from across Scotland. Supported by: Alex Neil, Donald Gorrie, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Robin Harper, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Pauline McNeill, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Tricia Marwick, Karen Whitefield, Mr Gil Paterson, Michael Russell, Irene Oldfather, Ms Sandra White, Nora Radcliffe, Mr David Davidson, Mary Scanlon*
S1M-1612 Ocean Youth Trust Scotland (lodged on 31 January 2001) Cathy Jamieson*, Trish Godman*, Scott Barrie*

S1M-1612 Margaret Jamieson: Ocean Youth Trust Scotland—That the Parliament congratulates the Ocean Youth Trust Scotland on its work with young people on the 70 ft sailing vessel ALBA VENTURER, which has taken over 500 young people to sea on adventurous voyages on 197 days over the past year; notes that Ocean Youth Trust Scotland has, over the past 26 years, taken some 14,000 young people from different backgrounds over 125,000 miles, as far afield as St Kilda and Taransay, and welcomes the continued partnership between the Trust and the Scottish Executive Education Department to ensure that this valuable resource remains available to young people from across Scotland. Supported by: Alex Neil, Donald Gorrie, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Robin Harper, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Pauline McNeill, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Tricia Marwick, Karen Whitefield, Mr Gil Paterson, Michael Russell, Irene Oldfather, Ms Sandra White, Nora Radcliffe, Mr David Davidson, Mary Scanlon, Cathy Jamieson, Trish Godman, Scott Barrie, Maureen Macmillan*, Rhoda Grant*
S1M-1612 Ocean Youth Trust Scotland (lodged on 31 January 2001) Elaine Smith*
